7 try:
8  from urllib.request import addinfourl, BaseHandler, build_opener, Request, URLError
9 except ImportError:
10  from urllib2 import addinfourl, BaseHandler, build_opener, Request, URLError
11 from argparse import ArgumentParser

13 NAME = 'download_checkmd5.py'

16 class HTTPRangeHandler(BaseHandler):
17 
18  def http_error_206(self, req, fp, code, msg, hdrs):
19  r = addinfourl(fp, hdrs, req.get_full_url())
20  r.code = code
21  r.msg = msg
22  return r
23 
24  def http_error_416(self, req, fp, code, msg, hdrs):
25  raise URLError('Requested Range Not Satisfiable')

27 
28 def download_with_resume(uri, dest):
29  handler = HTTPRangeHandler()
30  opener = build_opener(handler)
31 
32  offset = 0
33  content_length = None
34  accept_ranges = False
35  while True:
36  req = Request(uri)
37  if offset:
38  req.add_header('Range', 'bytes=%d-' % offset)
39  src_file = None
40  try:
41  src_file = opener.open(req)
42  headers = src_file.info()
43  if not offset:
44  # on first connection check server capabilities
45  if 'Content-Length' in headers:
46  content_length = int(headers['Content-Length'])
47  if 'Accept-Ranges' in headers:
48  accept_ranges = headers['Accept-Ranges'] != 'none'
49  else:
50  # on resume verify that server understood range header and responded accordingly
51  if 'Content-Range' not in headers:
52  raise IOError('Download aborted and server does not support resuming download')
53  if int(headers['Content-Range'][len('bytes '):].split('-')[0]) != offset:
54  raise IOError('Download aborted because server replied with different content range then requested')
55  sys.stdout.write(' resume from %d...' % offset)
56  sys.stdout.flush()
57  with open(dest, 'ab' if offset else 'wb') as dst_file:
58  progress = False
59  while True:
60  data = src_file.read(8192)
61  if not data:
62  break
63  progress = True
64  dst_file.write(data)
65  offset += len(data)
66  if not progress:
67  # if no bytes have been received abort download
68  raise IOError("No progress when trying to download '%s'" % uri)
69  except Exception:
70  if src_file:
71  src_file.close()
72  raise
73 
74  # when content length is unknown it is assumed that the download is complete
75  if content_length is None:
76  break
77  # or when enough data has been downloaded (> is especially a valid case)
78  if offset >= content_length:
79  break
80  if not accept_ranges:
81  raise IOError('Server does not accept ranges to resume download')
82 
83 
84 def download_md5(uri, dest):
85  """Download file from uri to file dest."""
86  # Create intermediate directories as necessary, #2970
87  dirname = os.path.dirname(dest)
88  if len(dirname):
89  try:
90  os.makedirs(dirname)
91  except OSError as e:
92  if e.errno != errno.EEXIST:
93  raise
94 
95  sys.stdout.write('Downloading %s to %s...' % (uri, dest))
96  sys.stdout.flush()
97  try:
98  download_with_resume(uri, dest)
99  sys.stdout.write(' done.\n')
100  except Exception as e:
101  # delete partially downloaded data
102  if os.path.exists(dest):
103  os.unlink(dest)
104  sys.stdout.write(' failed (%s)!\n' % e)
105  raise
106 
107 
108 def checkmd5(dest, md5sum=None):
109  """
110  Check file at dest against md5.
111 
112  :returns (boolean, hexdigest): True if dest contents matches md5sum
113  """
114  if not os.path.exists(dest):
115  return False, 'null'
116  with open(dest, 'rb') as f:
117  md5value = hashlib.md5()
118  while True:
119  buf = f.read(4096)
120  if not buf:
121  break
122  md5value.update(buf)
123  hexdigest = md5value.hexdigest()
124 
125  print('Checking md5sum on %s' % (dest))
126  return hexdigest == md5sum, hexdigest
127 
128 
129 def main(argv=sys.argv[1:]):
130  """Dowloads URI to file dest and checks md5 if given."""
131  parser = ArgumentParser(description='Dowloads URI to file dest. If md5sum is given, checks md5sum. If file existed and mismatch, downloads and checks again')
132  parser.add_argument('uri')
133  parser.add_argument('dest')
134  parser.add_argument('md5sum', nargs='?')
135  parser.add_argument('--ignore-error', action='store_true', help='Ignore download errors')
136  args = parser.parse_args(argv)
137 
138  uri = args.uri
139  if '://' not in uri:
140  uri = 'file://' + uri
141 
142  fresh = False
143  if not os.path.exists(args.dest):
144  try:
145  download_md5(uri, args.dest)
146  except Exception:
147  if args.ignore_error:
148  return 0
149  raise
150  fresh = True
151 
152  if args.md5sum:
153  result, hexdigest = checkmd5(args.dest, args.md5sum)
154  if result is False and fresh is False:
155  print('WARNING: md5sum mismatch (%s != %s); re-downloading file %s' % (hexdigest, args.md5sum, args.dest))
156  os.remove(args.dest)
157  try:
158  download_md5(uri, args.dest)
159  except Exception:
160  if args.ignore_error:
161  return 0
162  raise
163  result, hexdigest = checkmd5(args.dest, args.md5sum)
164  if result is False:
165  return 'ERROR: md5sum mismatch (%s != %s) on %s; aborting' % (hexdigest, args.md5sum, args.dest)
166 
167  return 0
168 
169 
170 if __name__ == '__main__':
171  sys.exit(main())
